required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this Post Approval Study is to report the proportion of patients surviving to 30 days post CentriMag support or to hospital discharge, whichever is longer. For subjects who do not recover and are bridged to a heart transplant or a long-term assist device, the primary endpoint is survival to induction of anesthesia for the surgery.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective, single arm, open-label, multi-center study

primary_outcome.measure: Survival to 30 days Post CentriMag support or to hospital discharge
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects who survive to 30 days post CentriMag support or to hospital discharge (whichever is longer).

primary_outcome.measure: Survival to induction of anesthesia for surgery for transplant or a long-term system
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects who do not recover and are bridged to a transplant or long-term system

arm_group.description: Subjects who receive the CentriMag Circulatory Support System

intervention.description: The CentriMag Circulatory Suppose System is indicated for providing support for up to 30 days for one or both ventricles of the heart to treat post-cardiotomy patients who fail-to-wean from cardiopulmonary bypass, providing a bridge to decision when it is unclear whether the patient's heart will recover or whether the patient will need alternative, longer-term therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject >18 years of age
- Subject or legal representative has signed Informed Consent Form (ICF)
- Subject has CentriMag Circulatory Support System implanted due to Failure To Wean from Cardiopulmonary Bypass
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
